name: Palace Casino Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 4 consecutive (Thur-Sun) nights on our first visit to Biloxi. Should have booked directly with the casino for the best rate, we booked through Yahoo (Travelocity) and paid about $7 a night more than what the hotel offers (no big deal). The room had two queen beds and was a little "tight" but overall we were very well satisfied.
reviews.title: Biloxi's best value
Slot Heaven
reviews.text: Biloxi is not Vegas!! It is more for slot players than table players. I play blackjack and like the opportunity to change tables often to change my luck. Table players are extremely limited in ANY casino in Biloxi. Driving from casino to casino is no problem and we never had a problem parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Palace is starting to show some wear, however it is kept clean and probably the best bargain in Biloxi. My only disappointment was that they stop serving breakfast at 11 am, as do the other casinos, however, for late night snacks the Palace only offers pre-made sandwiches and salads in a cafeteria style atmosphere.
reviews.title: Not Quite As Impressed As Other Reviewers...

likes.disliked: — Dated rooms, spotty carpet, very smoky casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The girls kept the drinks coming whether we were at the slots or the tables and we did enjoy our stay. Other casino hotels will charge you as if you're in Vegas and try to make you feel like your in Vegas, but believe me, YOU ARE NOT IN VEGAS!
reviews.title: Geat hotel. Nice Buffett. Smaller casino.
This is a top notch place to stay!
reviews.text: Stay at the Palace and drive to the others if you have to.

Beautiful hotel and the price was right. Very small casino in terms of table games but lots of slots. I am a table game player, and actually moved to a different hotel. I know that in blackjack and 3 card poker, the cards are what they are and go in cycles, but I have NEVER experienced a 3 day run where the bj dealer makes almost every hand. Even showing a 6 up, the dealer would make the hand with a 20 or 21. Yea, we all know this happens, but this kind of thing happened with a regularity that is WAY outside the curve, whether a shoe game or a double deck game. Would stay here again for the HOTEL but would not play here again.
reviews.title: nice place but...

likes.disliked: — small number of table games in casino

reviews.title: Loved This Place!
reviews.text: The rooms were awesome - plush and perfect - the bedding & even down to the towels in the bathroom. It was clean and very, very nice. We would stay there again in a heartbeat! We felt right at home at this hotel - they also had a hot tub for your use. The swimming pool was gorgeous - and there was a beautiful waterfall down by the pool also. The casino was nice and will be even nicer next year. They are going to have a gift shop a spa and plan to knock out a wall so there will be more black jack tables and probably more slots. This experience at the Palace - properly named - made our vacation most enjoyable!!!!! The bar were we had our happy hour each night was also very nice lots of seats and even some sofas and chairs that made it very comfortable. Can't say anything bad about our stay here - it was the nicest casino/hotel we have ever stayed at in Biloxi!!!

reviews.title: nice place to visit, but....
reviews.text: Nice hotel and casino, but long lines at the Player's Club, which Matt, the manager, will not do anything about. Guess he likes to keep old and disabled people standing on line ...

Me and my friend stayed at this hotel it was a really bad experience for us,we are a regular guest at this hotel before katrina and i did not have any problem before.The waiter when we eat at the breakfast got upset because we sit a couple table away from the other he almost did not give us drink until i said something to him.And not only that the front desk people they are rude not a good costumer service at all we paid a lot of money for presidential suites the room is great but service is really bad.I paid 575.00 per night in this hotel.
reviews.title: Bad Experience at this Hotel

likes.disliked: — Employees are not good on costumer service

reviews.text: We just got back from a 5 day stay at the Palace Casino Resort. There are only 3 casino/hotels open for business at this time. Katrina almost devastated the entire biloxi gulf port area. With that said, The Palace Casino is by no means a "resort;" for the whole place is "make shift" and temporary. Another Palace Casino Resort will be built across the street in 08. Today the casino has been placed in what WAS the grand entrance area. It is small, crowded and extremely smokey. One the weekends, you will probably have to wait to play black jack and numerous other tables. The least expensive table was $10. The $17 buffet was almost awful. What saved it from being horrible was that it had snow crab legs yet everything else was low class slop dinning. I would suggest going down the street to Boomtown Casino where it is not so smokey and the $17 buffet is at least edible. Lastly, The front desk acted as though you were bothering them whenever you had a question. Fortunatley, all the other workers were absolutely great and really extended themselves for their customers.
reviews.title: Cramped and Smokey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second or third time we stayed here and I tell you it's nice.For one thing it is the best priced casino or hotel on the coast,Usually around $100.The rooms are large and clean.Also it's about the only casino on the coast we win money.Try it you'll like it ,and you'll leave with a small bill and money in your pocket.
reviews.title: Under the Radar

reviews.text: i was there in dec of 08 i booked a king non smoking and got a twin bed. the room was ok but there was a smell of smoke from cigarets in the air, the casino was very smokey. if your a non smoker this place is not for you
reviews.title: not that hot

likes.disliked: — the smell of cigaret smoke and the fact they didn't give me the room i reserved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Palace on our honeymoon, we were on a tight budget and Palace was significantly less expensive than all of the other resorts in the Biloxi area. I have to admit that I was somewhat nervous as I had never been to the Palace and the fact that is was so much less expensive...I was more than pleasantly surprised. First, check in was quick and smooth and all of the staff was very friendly and helpful. When we got to the room we were both surprised at how large and clean the room was. The room was also very nicely decorated and everything was very comfortable.
reviews.title: A very nice stay.

likes.liked: — You get a great room for a great price!

reviews.text: During our stay we ate at Mignon's which was simply amazing and we also visited the buffet. Breakfast at the buffet was very good and lunch while not as good as the breakfast was good also.
reviews.title: Palace Casino, loved it

likes.liked: — Service of cocktail waitresses and dealers, hands down.
likes.disliked: — Slight color tint of the water in the jacuzzi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also did some gaming while at the Palace and it was one of the better casino experiences I have had. First of all the Palace offers $3 blackjack and craps on certain days and $.25 roulette also. The dealers were very friendly and helpful, more so than anywhere else I have played previously.
reviews.title: Loved the Palace

likes.liked: — There is the casino hopper to drive you around to the local casinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I got away from the kids for a night for our 11th anniversary and stayed at The Palace. We loved it. The rooms were very nice and clean as was the casino. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We are from South Louisiana, and were disapointed with their seafood dinner buffet, but the breakfast buffet was the best we have ever eaten. I do wish that we had a better view of the beach from our room, but other than that it was an absolutley wonderful trip.
reviews.title: Loved the Palace

likes.disliked: — wished it had a better view of beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palace for a weekend golf outing. Unfortunately, our golf was delayed due to the weather. Overall, the hotel was fine. The room was better than average, and the price was good. It's definitely not in the class of the current luxury casino hotels (not in the same price range either!), but it definitely is nicer than most of the mid-range chain hotels.
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.text: The casino is small, but nice. It doesn't have a poker room, however, which I found surprising.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star resort, Maybe 1

reviews.text: Their golf course, The Preserve, is AMAZING. It was beautiful, challenging, and peaceful.
reviews.title: Miserable experience

reviews.text: Went on a tour and stayed at numerous Biloxi Hotels.
reviews.title: nice room but....

likes.liked: — Clean Comfortable Room for a good price

description: Palace Casino Resort is the only smoke free casino on the Mississippi Gulf Coast and the premiere destination for luxurious accommodations, superior guest service and endless excitement. Nestled along the beautiful Gulf of Mexico and Biloxi’s Back Bay, the resort offers newly renovated hotel rooms and suites with stunning views, award winning restaurants, non-stop gaming, championship golf at The Preserve Golf Club and amazing amenities to complement your stay.
